text: Stefan Brink (born 1952) is a Swedish philologist affiliated with the Department of Anglo-Saxon, Norse and Celtic, University of Cambridge. ==Biography== Stefan Brink received his PhD in Nordic languages from Uppsala University in 1990. He was made a docent at Uppsala University in 1991, specializing in toponymy. He has been a visiting professor at Harvard University, the University of California, Los Angeles, Aarhus University and the University of Bergen. He is an Honorary Research Associate and formerly the Sixth Century Chair of Scandinavian Studies at the Department of Anglo- Saxon, Norse and Celtic, University of Cambridge. Brink is the editor of the journals Viking and Medieval Scandinavia and the academic series Acta Scandinavica. He is a member of the Royal Gustavus Adolphus Academy, the Royal Swedish Academy of Letters, History and Antiquities and the Royal Society of Edinburgh. ==See also== * Thorsten Andersson ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge Category:Germanic studies scholars Category:Living people Category:Old Norse studies scholars Category:Royal Gustavus Adolphus Academy Category:Swedish philologists Category:Uppsala University alumni Category:Uppsala University faculty Category:Toponymists
title: Stefan Brink
